page.title: 15Life For an Old Lady
page.content: Mrs Marsden was born in Eccleston in 1899. She lives in one of a number of bungalows specially built for old people. She likes the bungalow very much. She lives alone. Because of asthma she doesn't go on holiday, but every Sunday she travels by bus to visit her daughter who lives in Heskin, the next village. Her other daughter lives in Eccleston. Mrs Marsden does her own shopping and cooking, but a home-help from Social Services visits her for two hours every week. She spends most of her time reading, using a magnifying-glass, or watching television. She used to knit, but is now unable to see well enough. She used to attend the Over-Sixties Club, but no longer feels sufficiently fit to do so.
